column1: Tax Credits
column2: UCR University Extension Students may be eligible for a Federal Tax Credit through the Taxpayer Relief Act (TRA) of 1997.

column1: Veterans Benefits
column2: Veterans of the U.S. military who have available educational benefits can enroll in a UCR University Extension certificate program. We are approved by the Veterans Educational Benefits Program.

column1: Audit and Withdrawal
column2: If you wish to attend and participate in a course without receiving a grade, or need to withdrawal from a course, you can find all the answers you need here.

column1: Scholarships
column2: The academic and professional programs offered through UCR University Extension help individuals advance careers, increase opportunities for economic mobility, and explore personal growth.

column1: FERPA
column2: The Family Education Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA) affords students certain rights with respect to their education records.

column1: Accounting for Governmental and Nonprofit Organizations Certificate
column2: Complete the 12-unit Accounting for Governmental and Nonprofit Organizations certificate within 9-12 months. You'll learn: Budgeting and accounting practices for school districts, health care organizations, charities, and city government. Key accounting and financial reporting proceduresRegulatory requirements Taxation for nonprofits

column1: Business Management
column2: Complete the 12-unit Business Management certificate within 6 months.You'll learn: Core principles of human resources managementMethods for successful leadership in the workplaceSkills and strategies for a global eye in marketingHow to analyze consumer behaviorHow to implement and manage effective marketing strategiesEffective techniques for analyzing financial reportsMethods to develop practices for successful decision-making

column1: Entrepreneurial Modern Agriculture
column2: Complete the 6-unit Entrepreneurial Modern Agriculture certificate within 6 months.You'll learn: How to become an entrepreneur promoting technologies based around smart agriculture.Work with mentors to develop plans for your own startup companyEntry to a pitch competition for a chance to win up to $20,000 to start your own business. Develop a network of peers and collaborators to advance your career

column1: Emergency Resources
column2: In the event of an emergency, we want you to be informed and prepared. Learn about the resources available through the Office of Emergency Management with UCR University Extension.

column1: Accreditation and Standards of Conduct
column2: UCR University Extension is accredited by the Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC).

column1: Course Letters and Numbers
column2: Understand what the course letters and numbers mean so you can best select the course that's right for you.

column1: Credit Information and Continuing Education Units
column2: Find the information you need regarding credits and continuing education units (CEUs) for your study at UCR University Extension.

column1: CLAD Through CTEL
column2: Complete the 18-unit CLAD through CTEL certificate within 9-12 months.You'll learn: The relationship between culture/cultural diversity and academic achievement/developmentLanguage systems, forms and functionsFactors that impact second language developmentEffective assessment tools and strategies for English LearnersSecond language acquisitionMethods for academic content instruction

column1: Advanced Teaching and Administration in Early Child Care Settings
column2: Complete the 24-unit Advanced Teaching and Administration in Early Child Care Settings certificate within 12-24 months.You'll learn: Roles and responsibilities of the site administrator Principles of launching an educationally and financially sound programState licensing requirementsMethods for supervising student teachers, assistant teachers, parents, and volunteers Adult-child and child-child relationships and their influence on shaping behaviorHealth, nutrition and safety components of early care and educationApproaches to involving parents in the education of young children

column1: College Admissions Counseling Certificate
column2: Complete the 18-unit College Admissions Counseling certificate within 12-18 months. You'll learn: The selection process of colleges and universities How to work with gifted and underrepresented studentsMethods to prepare students for college entrance examsFinancial planning and admission procedures for small private colleges

column1: Introductory Supplementary Authorization in Computer Science Education
column2: Complete the 15-unit Computer Science Education certificate within 12 months.You'll learn: How computing systems and digital devices function, and how they have contributed to various disciplinesBest practices in problem solving techniques and fundamental computing concepts including decomposition, data representation and algorithmsHigh-level programming languages and advanced software design

column1: Accounting Certificate
column2: Complete the 36-unit Accounting certificate within 9-18 months.You'll learn: Tax Planning Financial Advising and Planning AuditingBudget AnalysisFinancial Statement PreparationApplication of Accounting PrinciplesLegal and regulatory requirements to become a certified public accountant (CPA).

column1: Impact Academy
column2: Complete the 8-course Impact Academy certificate within 4-16 weeks.You'll learn: Real-world development or conservation strategiesWays in which external factors affect initiatives, methods for how to identify the risks, and tips for preventing or managing them to ensure successful implementationA broad range of organizations through experiential learning opportunitiesMethods to prepare for a job search in development through mock interviews, portfolio reviews, recruiting, soft-skills training, and more

column1: Civic Education for the Digital Age
column2: Complete the 8-unit Civic Education for the Digital Age certificate within 6 months.You'll learn: Classic approaches to understanding democracy and civic learningHow the rise of digital media challenges these approachesMethods to transform civic learning and integrate it across the curriculumThe importance of digital literacy among youth and ways to demonstrate applicationHow to develop and implement a civic education-based lesson and best practices based on your observation and discussion with other educators in the course

column1: Finder
column2: Explore online or in-person certificates, teaching credentials, courses, or programs to prepare you to upskill, advance, or shift careers.

column1: Cannabis Healthcare and Medicine
column2: Complete the 9-unit Cannabis Healthcare and Medicine certificate within 6 months.You'll learn: Cannabis history, uses, culture, and industryMedicinal cannabis and industrial hemp, indoor and outdoor grow, biochemistry, botany, and phylogeneticsOperations and challenges in the various sectors of the industry, such as cannabis enterprise and cannabis law and policyMedical properties of cannabis, human physiology, and metabolismBest practices for patient care, including standard of care, drug interaction, psychoactivity, and toleranceMedical ethics and law for cannabis medicine, localized for your area of business or practiceThe endocannabinoid system and cannabinoid and terpene concentration, metabolism, absorption, and moreSpecial topics in either Animal and Pets or Human healthcare, depending on your chosen track

column1: Educational Therapy Certificate
column2: Complete the 22-unit Educational Therapy certificate within 12-18 months.You'll learn: Typical and atypical learning patternsHow to create and implement individualized treatment plansMethods for performing comprehensive personalized assessmentsComprehensive educational therapy plansSocial and emotional aspects that impede learningMethods for forming mutually supportive relationships with clients, families, schools and other involved professionals

column1: Cultural Competence and Social Justice Leadership
column2: Complete the 6-unit Cultural Competence and Social Justice Leadership certificate within 6 months.You'll learn: Differences and similarities with historical inequality in schoolsMethods to examine policies and practices against the impressions and results of action plans and used approachesStandards to use for analysis and policy development for cultural proficiency, and equal opportunity and barrier assessment for marginalized and privileged studentsApproaches to continued equity assessment and improvement in policies, classroom practices, and leadership

column1: The Business of Cannabis
column2: Complete the 9-unit Business of Cannabis certificate within 6 months.You'll learn: An introduction to the history, uses, culture, and industry of cannabis; medical cannabis; and industrial hempResponsibilities and roles of different industry-specific sectorsBusiness aspects and practices as they relate to a cannabis business, such as building infrastructure for your grow site, investment and banking, and challenges for commercial operationsIndustry-specific challenges, such as labs, distribution, and retail and deliverySector-specific challenges, such as real estate considerations, regulatory compliance, and insurance

column1: Marketing Certificate
column2: Complete the 18-unit Marketing certificate within 9-12 months. You'll learn: Digital and Social Media Marketing Marketing ManagementBusiness Marketing Marketing Principles Traditional Marketing Seven P's of Marketing  Marketing PsMarketing MixMarketing Plan

column1: Finder
column2: Explore online or in-person certificates, teaching credentials, courses, or programs to prepare you to upskill, advance, or shift careers.

column1: Timothy Lin
column2: UCR University Extension’s Professional Certificate in Accounting qualifies student to sit for the CPA exam and leads him towards Master’s in Accounting.

column1: Computer Technician Certificate
column2: Complete the 14-unit Computer Technician certificate within 12 months.You'll learn: Help Desk concepts, operation and supportPC hardware and architecture (A+ certification training)Physical and virtual networks including hubs, routers, Ethernet, TCP/IP protocols (Network+ certification training)Security concepts and procedures (Security+ certification training)

column1: Finder
column2: Explore online or in-person certificates, teaching credentials, courses, or programs to prepare you to upskill, advance, or shift careers.

column1: Mobile Digital Filmmaking
column2: Complete the 7-unit Mobile Digital Filmmaking certificate within 3 months.You'll learn: The basics of digital filmmaking and storytellingMethods to integrate video production into your curriculum while meeting TK-12 Common Core StandardsThe essential skills enhanced and reinforced through media literacy, such as interpersonal skills, critical thinking, and problem solvingWays for you to properly review and critique student productionsThe connection between production and storytelling through the assignment The Door SceneTwo student prompts for teaching camera technique in regard to perspective, motion, and composition

column1: Entrepreneurship
column2: Complete the 12-unit Entrepreneurship certificate within 6 months.You'll learn: Foundational marketing principlesMethods for developing financial plans, accounting systems, and incorporating, recruiting, fundraising and negotiating with investorsTips for integrating strategy, marketing, human resources, finance and productionKey business concepts

column1: Fiduciary Management
column2: Complete the 14-unit Fiduciary Management certificate within 12-15 months.You'll learn: Legal procedures and codesBusiness standards of practiceAccounting and asset managementEthics

column1: Forensic Nursing Certificate
column2: Complete the 16-unit Forensic Nursing certificate within 9-15 months.You'll learn: Techniques for collecting, preserving, and documenting forensic evidence Working with a multidisciplinary forensic teamTreatment for triageEmergency intervention for patients How to conduct sexual assault examinationsDeath investigationForensic evaluation of the deceasedEthical practice in forensic nursing

column1: Bilingual Authorization BILA
column2: Complete the 18-unit Bilingual Authorization certificate within 12 months.You'll learn: Methods of instruction for bilingual educationConcept of bilingualism, including language acquisition and developmentEffective approaches to understanding cross-cultural, intercultural and intra-cultural relationships and interactionsThe role of primary language instruction in the dual-language settingOverview of the historical, legal and legislative contexts of bilingual education in the U.S.A detailed look into the four domains of language – listening, speaking, reading and writingThe relationship between culture/cultural diversity and academic achievement/developmentLanguage systems, forms, functions, and factors that influence second language developmentEffective assessment tools and strategies for English LearnersMethods for academic content instruction

column1: Designated Subjects Career Technical Education and Special Subjects - Track A
column2: Complete the 19-unit Career Technical Education and Special Subjects certificate within 24 months.You'll learn: Curriculum development and instructional planning skills related to developing occupational oriented knowledge and skills in developing lesson plansStrategies for planning instruction, which is relevant to the diverse needs of students and various occupationsClassroom management strategies to develop and maintain a safe and effective learning environmentConcepts surrounding the CTE and Special Subject professions with highlights touching on the legal and ethical issues in the field

column1: Interpretation and Translation English/Spanish
column2: As language specialists interpreterstranslators serve as a crucial link between those who cannot understand English and those who serve them accurately conveying information concepts and ideas between languages Focus on the acquisition of specialized terminology Spanish to English and English to Spanish vocabulary and interpretation skills used in criminal and civil court matters

column1: Medical Education
column2: Complete the 12-unit Medical Education certificate within 9 months.You'll learn: How to create curriculum and effectively teach to healthcare professionalsHow to integrate your professional experience and evidence-based practice into meaningful learning experiencesNew methods to create an effective learning environment in diverse healthcare settingsHow to use assessment to improve learning outcomes

column1: Education for the Gifted and Talented
column2: Complete the 15-unit Education for the Gifted and Talented certificate within 12-24 months.You'll learn: Identification and evaluation of the gifted studentMethods for encouraging the progress of GATE studentsApproaches to enrich curriculum developmentTechniques to apply critical thinking skills across content areasSocial and emotional needs

column1: Teaching in Early Child Care Settings
column2: Complete the 25.5-unit Teaching in Early Child Care Settings certificate within 12-24 months.You'll learn: An overview of early childhood education with focus on the interrelationships among the child's environment and their physical, emotional, cognitive and social developmentMethods for integrating developmentally appropriate experiences and best practices through research-based curriculaReasons for how relationships affect children's behavior and developmentThe connections between home, school and community and their effects on the learning of children in different contexts

column1: Leadership and Organizational Excellence
column2: Complete the 12-unit Leadership and Organizational Excellence certificate within 6-12 months.You'll learn: Ways to build strategies that meet and manage the needs of organizational stakeholdersHow to identify new methods of decision-makingApproaches to managing organizational behavior including conflict, negotiations, workplace communication, and moreTools for examining the CMQ/OE body of knowledge including customer/supplier relations, strategic planning, and process improvementSystems for applying cultural diversity in the workplace, and cultural comprehension across the organizational structure

column1: Teaching Transitional Kindergarten
column2: Complete the 36-unit Teaching Transitional Kindergarten certificate within 12 months.You'll learn: Influences on children's biological, physical, social-emotional and cognitive developmentQuality teaching practices that address cultural and developmental differencesMethods for engaging parents and building a collaborative relationship between home and schoolLanguage development in children ages 0-5 and strategies for working with English learnersDifferentiated instruction techniques for TK-K combination classroomsEvidence-based curriculum and bridging the Preschool Learning Foundations with the Common Core State Standards

column1: Introductory Mathematics
column2: Complete the 16-unit Supplementary Authorization in Introductory Mathematics credential within 12-18 months.You'll learn: Content to enhance your understanding for teaching math curriculumMath approaches as they relate to the California Mathematics Framework, content standards and Common CoreHow to integrate cross-curricular teaching strategies and real-life applications into the classroom

column1: Sustainable Transportation Solutions and Community Impacts
column2: Find and implement intelligent transportation strategies in our local area that you can demonstrate how the health of the community is improved, and create new start-up industries in an area that needs the solutions the most.

column1: Social and Emotional Learning
column2: Complete the 6-unit Social and Emotional Learning certificate within 3 months.You'll learn: Research for Social Emotional Learning and available resourcesThe relationship between positive relationships and emotional connectionsThe Collaborative for Academic Social and Emotional Learning (CASEL) Social Emotional Competencies and the Formative Five skills for students’ emotional successDevelopment of an applicable plan for your classroom using both CASEL and the Formative Five

column1: Cannabis Agriculture and Horticulture
column2: Complete the 9-unit Cannabis Agriculture and Horticulture certificate within 6 months.You'll learn: An introduction to cannabis and cannabis use in history, culture, and industryBiochemistry and differences between medicinal cannabis and industrial hempResponsibilities and challenges of various sectors, such as an enterprise and cannabis medicine and healthLife cycles, optimal growing conditions, and harvesting best practices for indoor or outdoor plantsThe flowering cycle, pest control, and storage techniquesSpecial topics from an ecological and ethical perspective, such as super cropping and off-grid farming

column1: Turfgrass Management
column2: Complete the 30-unit Turfgrass Management certificate within 15-24 months.You'll learn: Efficient and environmentally sensitive management practices for turfgrass facilitiesScientific aspects of turfgrass managementPhysical and biological principles of plant processesHow to identify different turf speciesTechnical skills related to the design, maintenance and management of irrigation systems

column1: Postgraduate Diploma in Hospitality and Tourism Management
column2: Complete the 46-unit Postgraduate Diploma in Hospitality and Tourism Management program within 34 weeks.You'll learn: Tried-and-true methods for basic, multi-functional management applicationsVarious types of tourism and hospitality careers, integrated leadership skills, and related topicsHow to present your portfolio or yourself successfully and persuasively to potential clients or employersReal-world practice in a learning environment at an American workplace followed up with classroom discussion

column1: Professional Certificate in Online Course Design and Instruction
column2: Complete the 12-unit Online Course Design and Instruction certificate within 12 months.You'll learn: The impact of different learning environmentsThe online teaching journey based on course design formulaMethods for assessing student successThe development of quiz questions and assignments

column2: This orientation to the Designated Subjects Credential Program provides individuals interested in obtaining a Designated Subjects teaching credential with an understanding of the eligibility requirements to become a Career Technical Education or Special Subjects teacher, an overview of the program’s structure, requirements, and processes for obtaining and clearing the credential. column1: Internet of Things (IoT): Applications and Opportunities
column2: Complete the 9-unit Internet of Things (IoT) certificate within 9 months.You'll learn: The business opportunities of IoTDesign IoT solutions that sense, perceive, and react appropriatelyNew technologies that will be an ever-increasing part of our futureComponents of IoT devicesHow IoT applications use concepts of intelligence to increase personal and industry productivity and effectivenessIoT standards for interoperability, machine-to-machine communication, and securityA variety of techniques to connect to dataDifferent IoT technologies and their applicationsThe basic functionality of the Arduino and Raspberry Pi hardware systemsHow to secure and monitor the entire system of devices, the connectivity, and the information exchangeRelated network concepts including cellular, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth LE, ZigBee, and ZWave

column2: Explore online or in-person certificates, teaching credentials, courses, or programs to prepare you to upskill, advance, or shift careers.

column1: Tableau Data Analytics
column2: Complete the Tableau Data Analytics certificate within 18 weeks.You'll learn: Business framing techniques for analytical problem-solving processSpreadsheet software to clean, analyze, and synthesize dataHow to apply the Structured Query Language (SQL) in MySQL for data manipulation language (DML) and data definition language (DDL)Ways to optimize a large data set within Tableau to prepare for efficient manipulationHow to create and design Tableau visualizations, dashboards, and stories

column1: Nurse Death Investigation
column2: Complete the 16-unit Nurse Death Investigation certificate within 18 months.You'll learn: Roles and responsibilities of a nurse death investigatorBest methods for collecting evidence, documenting a scene, and photographing and preserving evidenceProcedures for identifying and confirming the decedent's identityChanges that occur to the body following death and the stages that followProcess and procedure of an autopsy

column1: Designated Subjects Career Technical Education and Special Subjects Bridge for Clear Multiple or Single Subject Teachers - Track B
column2: Complete the 12-unit Career Technical Education and Special Subjects Bridge certificate within 24 months.You'll learn: Curriculum development and instructional planning skills related to developing occupational oriented knowledge and skills in developing lesson plansStrategies for planning instruction, which is relevant to the diverse needs of students and various occupationsClassroom management strategies to develop and maintain a safe and effective learning environmentConcepts surrounding the CTE and Special Subject professions with highlights touching on the legal and ethical issues in the field

column1: Postgraduate Certificate in Computer Science
column2: Complete the 24-unit Postgraduate Certificate in Computer Science program within 12 weeks.You'll learn: Introductory and intermediate analysis of data structures and algorithms The various types of discrete structures as they relate to computer scienceTopics in machine organization and assembly language programming, such as computer instructions, input/output (I/O), and linkersMethods in software design and development, such as programming, testing, and debuggingPrinciples of operating system design, such as concurrency, file systems, security, and system performance

column1: Blockchain Technologies
column2: Complete the 12-unit Blockchain Technologies certificate within 6-15 months.You'll learn: What Blockchain is, who is using it, and why is it so revolutionaryThe mechanics behind Blockchain TechnologiesWhat the future holds for Blockchain applicationsTechnical applications, products and services best suited to Blockchain TechnologiesCryptocurrencies and the Crypto Ecosystem including Bitcoin and EthereumRelated software technologies that are used to build Blockchain products and servicesMethodologies and tools to apply Blockchain theories Blockchain applications, products, services, and what makes them unique from other online products and servicesCommon misconceptions, and challenges of Blockchain TechnologiesHardware needed for Blockchain Technologies

column1: Social Entrepreneurship, Engagement, and Development (SEED) Lab
column2: Complete the 9-unit Social Entrepreneurship Engagement and Development Lab (SEED Lab) certificate within 8 months.You'll learn: How to launch, pilot and/or scale mission-driven venturesHow to access local leaders, captains of various industries and experts and resourcesMethods for collaboration and networking with a small cohort of highly mission-driven entrepreneurs

column1: Supervision and Leadership
column2: Complete the 7-unit Supervision and Leadership certificate within 3 months.You'll learn: Essential tools to be an effective supervisor, including how to evaluate others, providing constructive feedback, and providing clear objectivesCore managerial skills and strategies for managing changeCommunication techniques for delivering information successfullyMethods to achieve key organizational results through coaching and mentoringPrinciples and dynamics for high performance work teams, including how to positively manage workplace differences

column1: Specialized Study Program in Online Course Design and Instruction
column2: Complete the 6-unit Specialized Study Program in Online Course Design and Instruction certificate within 6 months.You'll learn: Differences between online learning and face-to-face learning, as well as synchronous and asynchronous learningIntroductory and advanced types of assessment methods, including developing learning objectives, quiz construction, and collaborative peer assessmentMethods for using the Canvas LMS to develop and deliver course content, such as slides and discussionsPractice delivery of an online course, including developing best practices and using rubrics and discussion board responses for instructor feedback

column1: Project Management for Business Certificate
column2: Complete the 9-unit Project Management for Business certificate within 6 months.You'll learn: How to manage multiple projectsHow to identify, analyze and manage risk during each stage of a project lifecycleTechniques for keeping a project on scheduleWays to build a functional and effective teamLeadership roles and responsibilitiesEffective communication techniquesEthical procedures Professional accountability

column1: Specialized Study Program in Lean Six Sigma
column2: Complete the 6-unit Specialized Study Program in Lean Six Sigma certificate within 3 months.You'll learn: History, essentials, and the versatility of application of Lean Six SigmaLean practices and Six Sigma key principles, including process flow, value stream mapping, 5-S improvement, set-up reduction, and rapid improvement methodsThe principle of DMAIC, or Define, Measure, Analyze, Improve and ControlProject planning and definition; team identification; performance metrics, implementation, and analysis; problem solving tools; and mistake proofingReal-world application of all lessons using either a real or work project

column1: Design Thinking Executive Program
column2: Complete the 8-module Design Thinking Executive Program certificate within 6 months.You'll learn: Challenging interdisciplinary curriculumHow to analyze, create and deliver unique customer experiencesHow to solve real-world challenges and use innovative practices developed by top companies

column1: Salesforce Administrator Career
column2: Complete the Salesforce Administrator Career certificate within 15 weeks.You'll learn: How to use Salesforce Sales Cloud Lightning to manage accounts, opportunities, products, quotes and contractsHow to build reports, charts and dashboards to communicate relevant information about the sales process and sales performance to stakeholders and executivesHow to design and build custom Salesforce apps that support business requirementsHow to standardize custom business processes and perform automated actionsHow to configure advanced reporting and analytical tools to explore sales performance and address business questions

column1: Postgraduate Diploma in Big Data Technologies
column2: Complete the 46-unit Postgraduate Diploma in Big Data Technologies program within 34 weeks.You'll learn: The essentials of practical and contemporary management methodsHow to "mine" and predict patterns in data for problem-solving and other initiativesCloud-based technologies and how they support Big DataHow these skills and others are applied in an American business or how to promote yourself to another American business

column1: STEM
column2: Complete the 10-unit STEM certificate within 6 months.You'll learn: Critical thinking and reasoning skills through the academic writing processBest practices for finding, organizing, understanding, and explaining data and research in problem-solvingYour choice of two electives to explore, including topics in technology like robotics; the environment, including market dynamics; science and cosmology; and applied data science in different disciplines

column1: Diversity and Multiculturalism
column2: Complete the 8-unit Diversity and Multiculturalism certificate within 9 months.You'll learn: Historical context for privilege, diversity, and oppression locally and globallySelf-reflection practices to understand social issues that they’ve experienced or witnessed and how to identify them in their larger communitiesInternship and job preparation skills like interviewing and resume writing

column1: Practice-Based Coaching through Distance Learning
column2: Complete the 9-unit Practice-Based Coaching through Distance Learning certificate within 6 months.You'll learn: The history of and research behind practice-based coachingBest practices for teaching adult learners, including keeping them motivated, building a collaborative relationship, and overcoming challengesHow the three-part cycle of practice-based coaching supports teaching practices that ultimately result in better learning experiences for childrenApplication of all practices learned with observations through a video library

column1: Graduate Preparation Program (GPP)
column2: Complete the Graduate Preparation Program (GPP) within 40 weeks.You'll learn: Insight into industry best practicesHands-on experience in research labs (if applicable to the field)

column1: Transformative Leadership in Disruptive Times Executive Program
column2: Complete the 8-module Transformative Leadership in Disruptive Times Executive Program certificate within 6-12 months.You'll learn: How to think critically How to prepare to solve real-world challengesHow to build and refine your tool set while developing a unique road map to use in your organization

column1: Postgraduate Diploma in Project Management
column2: Complete the 46-unit Postgraduate Diploma in Project Management program within 34 weeks.You'll learn: The ins and outs of the project management application: Microsoft ProjectHow to apply the fundamental concepts of project management and different project management stylesLeadership and team building techniques to earn the respect and cooperation of your colleaguesHow to manage information systems projectsThe dynamic of a project manager’s role in an American business environment

column2: Complete the 46-unit Postgraduate Diploma in Digital Marketing program within 34 weeks.You'll learn: Effective and contemporary strategies in managementSocial media and marketing techniques, including video and audio productionThe roles of WordPress, SEO, email, and other tools in current marketing campaigns and strategiesHow to highlight your marketing skills and experience using a digital portfolio

column2: Complete the 46-unit Postgraduate Diploma in Leadership and Organizational Excellence program within 34 weeks.You'll learn: Special topics in contemporary leadership, such as performance improvement, employee motivation and retention, and team-building approachesTechniques to enhance your portfolio or promote yourself to a potential employerPractical application of all lessons learned in an American workplace and discussion sessions with other students

column1: Postgraduate Diploma in Entertainment and Media Management
column2: Complete the 46-unit Postgraduate Diploma in Entertainment and Media Management program within 48 weeks.You'll learn: Ins and outs of American management skills and applicationImpact and integration of essential production steps, such as cinematography and lightingHow to build a portfolio that highlights your potential and demonstrates your value to companiesThe inner workings How American production sets operate through an internship

column1: Supplementary Authorization in Introductory English
column2: Complete the 16-unit Supplementary Authorization in Introductory English credential within 3 months.You'll learn: Advanced writing that integrates literature and vocabulary usageMultiple paragraph compositions with analogies, paraphrasing, points of view and transitionsClassic works of American literatureGrammar, parts of speech and principles of standard sentence structure

column1: Postgraduate Diploma in Engineering Management
column2: Complete the 46-unit Postgraduate Diploma in Engineering Management program within 34 weeks.You'll learn: Various fundamental and contemporary skills related to leadership and managementSpecial topics in engineering based on electives of your choosingMethods to refining your professional image through your portfolio and personal marketing skillsBest practices for application of your management skills through an internship at an active business

column1: Postgraduate Diploma in Event Management
column2: Complete the 46-unit Postgraduate Diploma in Event Management program within 34 weeks.You'll learn: A firm basis for American management styles to successfully lead a teamThe spectrum of possible events to coordinate, including sports events and fundraisersMethods to build credibility for your business and market it to clientsHow American businesses organize various events through an internship

column1: Postgraduate Diploma in Global Logistics and Supply Chain Management
column2: Complete the 49-unit Postgraduate Diploma in Global Logistics and Supply Chain Management program within 34 weeks.You'll learn: How to identify the international supply chains at global and regional levelsThe functionality of supporting infrastructures of the transport and logistics fieldKey elements of international traffic operations, imports and exports and documentation Social Corporate Responsibility and its applications

column2: An introduction to the characteristics of governmental and nonprofit accounting emphasizing the various fund types and account groups. Includes a review and evaluation of presently recommended accounting and financial reporting procedures for state and local governmental units. Covers both the theoretical and practical aspects of governmental and nonprofit accounting.

column2: Explore online or in-person certificates, teaching credentials, courses, or programs to prepare you to upskill, advance, or shift careers.

column1: Accounting for Governmental and Nonprofit Organizations II Course
column2: This course expands on the basic concepts of governmental and nonprofit accounting, including financial reporting of state and local governments, analysis of governmental financial performance, auditing for government and nonprofit organizations, budgeting and costing of government services, federal government accounting and reporting, common accounting issues surrounding nonprofits, regulatory and taxation for nonprofits, accounting issues surrounding colleges, universities and health care organizations.

column1: Admission Preparation Program (APP)
column2: Complete the Admission Preparation Program (APP) within 35 weeks.You'll learn: The American college application processHow to articulate and demonstrate intercultural and socio-emotional awareness and understandingWays to develop critical academic skills to ensure college course successMethods to improve your academic English speaking and writing

column1: Postgraduate Diploma in Management
column2: Complete the 46-unit Postgraduate Diploma in Management program within 34 weeks.You'll learn: How to take a global approach to human resources, marketing, and financeEffective tactics to manage change given rapid evolution of work environmentsSpecialized skills to create a successful event, manage large-scope projects, apply advanced accounting principles, or strengthen an organization's workforce

column1: Auditing: Financial Course
column2: Provides an examination of auditing theory, principles and practices as they apply to financial accounting, including governmental audit principles. Students explore common audit requirements and reporting standards, preparing for an audit, the purpose and use of audit results, documentation, establishing and maintaining internal controls, use of statistical methods in audits, objective and subjective audit criteria, ethics, legal requirements and standards for warehousing and securing data.

column1: Interaction Design and Prototyping for XR
column2: UCR Extension has partnered with Circuit Stream to offer courses in XR development that will allow you to obtain industry-recognized certification to take your career or project to the next level.

column1: Digital Marketing
column2: Complete the 3-unit Digital Marketing certificate in 3 months.You'll learn: Valuable insight into marketing trendsStrategic design techniques to achieve effective solutionsMethods to analyze customer psychologyHow to drive marketing strategy application

column1: Construction Budget, Accounting and Contract Management Course
column2: This course covers topics such as the fundamentals of finance, cost management strategies, basic concepts and methods of financial and managerial accounting, cash flow and revenues projection, payment scheduling, and contract preparation and management. Participants explore the methods commonly used for cost budgeting, procurement of materials, equipment and labor, subcontracting, as well as control of the various financial components of a construction project.

column1: Cost Accounting Course
column2: Theory and practices of cost accounting and control with special attention given to cost accounting in the manufacturing supply chain and service industries. Also examined are common procedures used for standard costing and analysis, cost accounting systems and controls, profit analysis, and budget preparation.

column1: Financial Reporting Course
column2: Intermediate-level exploration of financial accounting theory, principles and practices. Topics include interpretation, use, processing and presentation of principal accounting statements and generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP). Other topics include valuation, recording, presentation and control of cash, receivables, inventories and liabilities.

column1: Specific Supplementary Authorization in Computer Science Education
column2: Complete the 19-unit Computer Science Education certificate within 12 months.You'll learn: How computing systems and digital devices function, and how they have contributed to various disciplinesBest practices in problem solving techniques and fundamental computing concepts including decomposition, data representation and algorithmsHigh-level programming languages and advanced software design

column1: Financial Statement Analysis Course
column2: Covers the use of financial statements for analyzing investments, company portfolios and making strategic business decisions. Topics include analyzing cash flow, pro forma, ratios, balance sheets and income statements. Participants learn how to identify trends and forecast future performance. Discussion also focuses on use of financial statements in management decision-making and strategic planning, and on legal and ethical requirements defined by the Sarbanes-Oxley Act.

column1: Fraud and Ethics in Accounting Course
column2: An in-depth course that provides both examination and analysis of accounting fraud, and explores ethical practices as they apply to real-world companies. Gain an understanding of the most common and frequently used methods of accounting fraud, and how they may be used to misstate a company’s financial position. Learn how fraud has caused great institutional and economic problems, which led the government to enact strict transparent policies through the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, and the Dodd-Frank Act of 2010. Analyze the ethical dilemmas of fraudulent organizations, and explore how executives justified their unethical behavior. Learn to identify the elements of accounting fraud; recognize the pervasiveness of accounting fraud; understand and explain the frequently used methods of accounting fraud; discuss the largest corporations to commit accounting fraud in the past 20 years; explain the main elements of Sarbanes-Oxley reform; identify and describe the three major normative ethical theories; and apply the American Accounting Association Ethical Decision-Making Model to organizational dilemmas.

column1: Internal Auditing: Operational and Management Course
column2: Participants explore internal audit procedures, including internal controls, managing the audit process, working papers, procedures, sampling, evidence, and business process mapping. Topics include major areas of operational audits, including production, marketing, finances, purchasing, information technology, personnel and inventories. Also discussed are fraud detection, management audits and establishing ongoing internal controls.

column1: International Finance Course
column2: Focus on international financial management and trade from the perspective of managers doing business globally. Topics include the management of foreign exchange exposure, foreign direct investment decisions, multinational capital budgeting, trends in international banking, the balance of payments, the determination of exchange rates, the LDC debt crisis, and the Asian meltdown. Examine the challenges and problems faced by firms planning on doing business in Western Europe, Asia, Mexico, Canada, South America, Africa, India, and other regions.

column1: IRS Enrolled Agent Examination Review Course
column2: This course is designed for tax professionals wishing to pursue the Enrolled Agent designation.  As an Enrolled Agent, tax professionals may represent clients to the IRS.  This represents a significant opportunity for anyone who is currently in the tax field and wishes to increase their professional standing within the community and raise their earning potential.  The course provides a comprehensive review and discussion of past EA exams as well as a prospective of the roles and responsibilities of an EA.  Topics include:  filing requirements; gross income; gains and losses; deductions; depreciation and losses; and individual, partnership and corporate income tax.  The program also provides continuing education credit for accountants, attorneys and tax preparers.

column1: Introduction to International Trade Course
column2: Learn the necessary procedures to start up an international trading business using a detailed introduction to the practices, procedures, and services used in the U.S. to export and import merchandise. Topics include: organizations affecting international trade; sources of information for trading, monitoring, and evaluating commercial conditions in other countries; market research and planning; identifying potential suppliers, pricing merchandise, and resources to find buyers; sales channels; direct sales, agents, distributors, and representatives; merchandise regulations; control of exports and imports, international classification system, responsibilities of U.S. Customs, rules and related dues; financing; sources of funds for exports and imports, methods of payment, open account, direct, offsets, counter trade, barter, foreign currency exchanges, and contracts; freighting; modes of transport, packaging, containerization, protection, and identification of merchandise and insurance.

column1: Managerial Accounting Course
column2: Introduction to theory, principles and practices of managerial accounting, including the use of accounting information to plan and control and to provide strategic guidance for decision-making in the firm. The class examines different managerial accounting systems and their uses to solve problems and develop corporate strategies. Includes case studies of the application of analytical decision-making strategies and an exploration of ethics involved in accounting and managerial decision-making.

column1: Principles of Accounting Course
column2: An introduction to accounting theory, principles and practice, covering the uses, communication and processing of accounting information, as well as the recording, analyzing and summarizing procedures used in preparing balance sheets and income statements. Other topics include accounting for purchases and sales, receivables and payables, cash and inventories, plant and equipment, depreciation and natural resources, intangible assets and payrolls. Sole proprietorships and partnerships also are examined.

column1: QuickBooks: Accounting and Finance Application for Business Course
column2: This course provides participants with a comprehensive overview of QuickBooks, a leading accounting and finance software package for small organizations and home-based businesses. The course includes an introduction to basic accounting and finance principles and common bookkeeping practices. Participants also explore navigation, creation and maintenance of various forms and reports within QuickBooks.

column1: Finder
column2: Explore online or in-person certificates, teaching credentials, courses, or programs to prepare you to upskill, advance, or shift careers.

column1: Financial Planning and Management for Business Course
column2: Learn how to do your own bookkeeping and use your records as a management tool.  Develop an understanding of budgeting and financial planning including inventory control, cash flow management, end of month summary procedures, accounts payable, accounts receivable, cash receipts, cash disbursements, profit and loss controls, internal controls and back-up needed for tax deductions.

column1: The Budgetary Process in Governmental and Nonprofit Organizations Course
column2: Students examine concepts and practices of budgeting in the public and nonprofit sectors. Students are exposed to how budgets are prepared, developed and implemented through political processes, boards of directors, agencies, etc. Topics include: overview of the budgetary process, preparing budgets and understanding the role of stakeholders in the budgetary process.

column1: Tax Planning Course
column2: Surveys income tax planning opportunities, issues and potential problems. Focus is on the relationship between common income tax rules/regulations and the planning techniques applicable to individuals, tax shelters and corporations. Topics include income, deductions, rates and credits; sales and exchanges; real estate; tax shelters; small corporations and tax planning for the individual shareholders and employees; partnerships and sub chapter S corporations; retirement plans; and overall coordination of the various planning techniques.

column1: Taxation -- Partnerships Course
column2: This class examines aspects of partnerships from formation to liquidation. Normal operations as well as unique areas such as capital accounts, distribution of property and transfer of a partnership interest are covered. Tax advantages and problems of partnership entities are also discussed.

column1: Academic and Administrative Models in Higher Education Course
column2: This course provides students with an overview of academic and administrative models in higher education in the United States, including faculty administration, academic programming, the student application process as well as student career planning. Through lectures from guest speakers currently working in the field as well as visits to various departments at the University of California, Riverside campus, students gain exposure to a broad overview of the US education system and how that may apply to their own work. This course provides participants with valuable insights to more effectively work within the higher education system, and best practices to apply to their own professional and educational contexts.

column1: Finder
column2: Explore online or in-person certificates, teaching credentials, courses, or programs to prepare you to upskill, advance, or shift careers.

column1: Accounting and Finance for Heritage Professionals Course
column2: This course provides a practical overview of the principles and foundation of accounting as relevant to the heritage industry. Heritage industry practitioners work in a wide variety of environments ranging from consulting to tourism. In addition to area-specific experience and education, successful practitioners require an understanding of finance that includes accounting, project life cycles, critical consumption and management of capital, and basic tax planning. In this course, participants will explore accounting and finance best practices for private, non-profit, and governmental heritage-related businesses. Active learners will engage industry-specific case studies and apply methods of financial management, analysis, and planning to solve real-world problems.

column1: Brand Marketing:  Development and Strategy Course
column2: Discover and learn the intricacies in the development of a brand.  You learn how brand identity must be developed and managed to positively affect a company's performance and future, as well as understand the power and importance of a brand from its creation through implementation.  Look at and discuss brand research and development; brand history; brand management structures for sales, marketing, advertising, and promotional purposes; the differences between brand equity and identity; how brands are won and lost; and the impact of social media on the process of brand building.  Also, explore how companies develop financial wealth by extending existing brands and controlling and/or influencing brand pricing and distribution.

column1: Analyzing the American Workplace Course
column2: To be an effective employee in the United States, you need to understand how organizational systems work, have a clear understanding of your assigned roles and responsibilities, and how they relate to an organization’s goals. Participants will explore the American work culture and compare it to other countries’ work cultures, including students’ home countries, while investigating a specific U.S. organization through workplace observation. In-class, learners share their American workplace observations and discuss common, work-related issues. Priority is also given to developing “soft skills” such as team work, problem solving, and decision making, as well as developing skills in leadership, communication and time management. A final emphasis will be placed on leveraging participants’ internship experiences, KSA’s (Knowledge, Skills and Abilities), and competencies, while enhancing their online, professional profiles for ongoing career development and growth.

column1: Building Technology-Centric Organizations Course
column2: The goal of this course is to introduce and provide hands-on experience to the students on the most common technologies used in business today and in the near future. Technology, specifically software, is changing at a break-neck pace and is being led by the consumer.  Every company, and virtually every role in the organization of the future, will have to interface in some manner with technological tools and processes, and the most in-demand and well-paying careers require knowledge and working experience in one or more technology software and hardware tools. This course offers an introduction to the most transformative technologies in use or impending mass utilization in the next five to ten years, plus an overview of commerce and retail, online marketing activities and technologies, customer acquisition and growth, enterprise technologies such as ERP and supply chain management, web, mobile, and voice application design, Customer Relationship Management / CRM, social media channels, Customer Experience (CX) and User Interface (UI), Internet of Things (IoT) and more. In addition, business aspects such as customer acquisition and growth planning, startup funding options, investor management, pitches and product, project management, leadership and team building will be covered.

column1: Business Management for Heritage Professionals Course
column2: This course provides an introduction and overview of the heritage industry from a business perspective. It covers the global economic context of the heritage industry today, and how the industry transitioned over the last 50 years from a primarily public to a primarily private industry. The class provides an introduction to business, business concepts, and how business is conducted in private heritage organizations. Students will gain a basic introduction to heritage industry economics and business fundamentals so that they may succeed in the more in-depth topical classes in this program.

column1: Building Corporate Business Models: Enhancing Productivity Course
column2: Learn how corporate business models enhance productivity, increase revenues, and yield higher returns on investments. Examine the strategies needed to implement corporate business models in different industries and customer segments across the globe. By studying successful corporate business models from Tesla, Toyota, South West Airlines Corporation, Starbucks, and others, develop your own new business model to improve performance, productivity, profit, and best practices for your business or organization.

column1: Business Operations Course
column2: Learn the critical and practical aspects of managing a small business venture and implementing solutions that work. In addition to gaining an understanding and appreciation of basic business operations and management systems, this course will cover the skills needed to successfully and effectively manage your business, including project management, time management, decision making, and the ability to manage others.

column1: Cannabis 101: History and Practice Across Industries Course
column2: This course serves as a broad introduction to the cannabis genus and its various uses across history, culture, and industry. Learners begin with an exploration into medicinal cannabis and industrial hemp, trace the biochemistry of phytocannabinoids and endocannabinoids, compare differences between indoor and outdoor grow, and review cannabis botany and phylogenetics. Weeks 4-6 introduce learners to industry-specific sectors: the challenges with retail and distribution, vending, finance, and human resources in Cannabis Enterprise; an overview of regulation, insurance, payroll and taxes, intellectual property, insurance, and labor law in Cannabis Law & Policy; and the basic requirements for choosing medical products, FDA regulation, and future opportunities for allied health professionals in Cannabis Medicine & Healthcare.

column1: Cannabis 101: History and Practice Across Industries Course
column2: This course serves as a broad introduction to the cannabis genus and the plants’ various uses across history, culture, and industry. Learners begin with an exploration into medicinal cannabis and industrial hemp, trace the biochemistry of phytocannabinoids and endocannabinoids, compare differences between indoor and outdoor grow, and review cannabis botany and phylogenetics. Weeks 4-6 introduce learners to industry-specific sectors: the challenges with retail and distribution, vending, finance, and human resources in Cannabis Enterprise; an overview of regulation, insurance, payroll and taxes, intellectual property, insurance, and labor law in Cannabis Law & Policy; and the basic requirements for choosing medical products, FDA regulation, and future opportunities for allied health professionals in Cannabis Medicine & Healthcare.

column1: Dates and Fees
column2: Our mission is to ensure high quality, innovative English language and professional programs to meet the diverse personal, professional, and educational goals of our students. Our curriculum is continually evaluated and updated to ensure the best possible learning experience.

column1: Internships
column2: The Postgraduate Internship program allows you to gain experience through a structured, 12-week work integrated learning experience, where you get to work with actual companies in the community and throughout the United States.

column1: Optional Practical Training OPT
column2: Optional Practical Training (OPT) allows you the opportunity to apply your new knowledge and skills on-the-job, off campus, in your chosen subject. You can work in a full-time salaried position for up to one year on your F-1 (student) visa.

column1: Academic Study Programs
column2: Customize your academic journey and create a unique study abroad experience. Take select undergraduate, graduate, and academic courses, and gain in-depth knowledge in a variety of subjects.

column1: Custom Programs
column2: Our custom programs allow you to design a program specifically to your needs, while also giving you the opportunity to experience American culture, and take fun trips to famous attractions in Southern California.

column1: Cannabis Agriculture & Horticulture I: Plant Care and Vegetative Cycle Course
column2: The Cannabis Agriculture & Horticulture sequence elaborates upon the entire cultivation process, highlighting the life cycles of the cannabis plant, optimal planting techniques, and how to treat and handle the plant after harvesting. During the first course, learners discover the Vegetative Cycle of the Cannabis Plant, including botany, genetics, seed germination and transplanting, asexual propagation, and factors to consider when developing a hospitable growth environment, including soil, growing media, light sources, and watering essentials. Learners begin the certificate final project during Week 1 of this course, specializing in an indoor or outdoor track and simulating a grow site with either industrial hemp or Urtica dioica at home.

column1: English Language Programs
column2: Our Intensive English Language Programming offers you flexible, year-round, multi-level programming designed to meet your multimedia curricular needs.

column1: Cannabis Agriculture & Horticulture I: Plant Care and Vegetative Cycle Course
column2: The Cannabis Agriculture & Horticulture sequence elaborates upon the entire cultivation process, highlighting the life cycles of the cannabis plant, optimal planting techniques, and how to treat and handle the plant after harvesting. During the first course, learners discover the Vegetative Cycle of the Cannabis Plant, including botany, genetics, seed germination and transplanting, asexual propagation, and factors to consider when developing a hospitable growth environment, including soil, growing media, light sources, and watering essentials. Learners begin the certificate final project during Week 1 of this course, specializing in an indoor or outdoor track and simulating a grow site with either industrial hemp or Urtica dioica at home.

column1: Intensive English PLUS
column2: Reach your goals and expand your professional skillset with core content to set you apart from the rest and put you at the head of the pack.

column1: Cannabis Compliance & Risk Management I Course
column2: This course lays the foundation for a Cannabis Risk Management Framework. A Cannabis Risk Management Framework (CRMF) is a framework for which risks, and opportunities can be identified within the context of business objectives and programs are established to operate within the risk appetite. The commercial cannabis business can assess the risks and understand the risk profile once objectives and the risk appetite are set. The risk assessment enables prioritization and tailoring of the risk-based control activities. To establish the optimal risk-based decisions, management uses the risk profile to inform its analysis of business opportunities. The dynamic nature of operating a business requires effective monitoring of known risks to identify changes to the risk profile over time. Training informs all individuals of their job responsibilities in compliance with company policies.

column1: Short-Term Culture and Language
column2: Join us in sunny Southern California for a culture and language experience. Expand your mind, increase your global awareness,and build a meaningful intercultural understanding.

column1: Cannabis Agriculture & Horticulture II: The Flowering Cycle and Maximizing Yields Course
column2: The second course for the Cannabis Agriculture & Horticulture sequence focuses on the flowering cycle: Learners discover phases of the flowering cycle in relation to plant metabolism, reproduction, and growth; review cannabis biochemistry; and consider environmental challenges including pests, diseases, and threats; tips for optimal harvesting and drying; processes for trimming and processing; and methods for curing and storage. During the final week, learners explore bonus topics in super cropping, backyard grows, and off-grid farming in the context of ecological awareness and current ethical questions of biodiversity.

column1: Masters Pathways
column2: At UCR University Extension, we offer three tiers of graduate-level studies, each providing an in-depth, hands-on educational experience to help you earn a Master's degree.

column1: Cannabis Agriculture & Horticulture II: The Flowering Cycle and Maximizing Yields Course
column2: The second course for the Cannabis Agriculture & Horticulture sequence focuses on the flowering cycle: Learners discover phases of the flowering cycle in relation to plant metabolism, reproduction, and growth; review cannabis biochemistry; and consider environmental challenges including pests, diseases, and threats; tips for optimal harvesting and drying; processes for trimming and processing; and methods for curing and storage. During the final week, learners explore bonus topics in super cropping, backyard grows, and off-grid farming in the context of ecological awareness and current ethical questions of biodiversity.

column1: Cannabis Compliance & Risk Management II Course
column2: This course addresses risk assessment as the foundation of a well-designed risk program. The risk assessment process enables management to better identify and mitigate gaps in a commercial cannabis business’s control of activities. It is sound practice that the risk assessment is formally written and in accordance with a methodology that is easily understood by all relevant parties. In this course, we’ll discover that a risk assessment is a three-step process that measures three indicators, enabling management to analyze risk that may affect business objectives. Each commercial cannabis business will have its own specific methodologies for conducting a risk assessment, however all methodologies will measure the following indicators: 1. Inherent risk: The risks specific to a commercial cannabis business before controls are implemented; 2. Quality of controls: The effectiveness of controls to mitigate risk; 3. Residual risk: The risk remaining after the control activities have been applied to an inherent risk.

column1: University Pathway Programs
column2: Join the many international students who have taken our university preparation programs and found success. Prepare to make a successful application to your desired undergraduate or graduate degree program at UCR with our University Preparation and Pathways programs. Find essential program dates and fees here.

column1: Professional Certificates
column2: Invest in your future by completing a specialized program or earn a professional certificate. Join experts who bring real-world experience to the classroom, and provide stimulating coursework to challenge your thinking.

column1: Postgraduate Certificate and Diploma Programs
column2: Now that you have earned your Bachelor's degree, set yourself apart. Our Postgraduate Certificate and Diplomas provide in-depth knowledge and on-the-job experience, giving you an advantage when you apply for jobs.

column1: Postgraduate Programs
column2: Now that you've earned your Bachelor's degree, or completed 3 years of your undergraduate degree, we want to help you differentiate yourself from others in your field. One-Year Postgraduate Diplomas provide in-depth knowledge and on-the-job experience that will give you a unique advantage when applying for jobs. Find essential program dates and fees here.

column1: Cannabis Healthcare & Medicine I: Essentials of Cannabis Medicine Course
column2: This course advances the knowledge and practice of cannabis medicine for health care providers and allied health professionals by improving their understanding of cannabis’s medical properties, human physiology and the metabolic pathways for cannabis, the ethics and law for cannabis healthcare practitioners, partnering with integrated medical centers, and client care. Learners refresh their knowledge of the History of Cannabis Medicine, and the biochemistry and metabolism of phyto- and endo-cannabinoids. We then progress to best practices, including standard of care; strain selection, dosing, and titration; routes and administration; and challenges with drug interaction, tolerance, psychoactivity and toxicity, and contraindication.

column1: Cannabis Healthcare & Medicine I: Essentials of Cannabis Medicine Course
column2: This course advances the knowledge and practice of cannabis medicine for health care providers and allied health professionals by improving their understanding of cannabis’s medical properties, human physiology and the metabolic pathways for cannabis, the ethics and law for cannabis healthcare practitioners, partnering with integrated medical centers, and client care. Learners refresh their knowledge of the History of Cannabis Medicine, and the biochemistry and metabolism of phyto- and endo-cannabinoids. We then progress to best practices, including standard of care; strain selection, dosing, and titration; routes and administration; and challenges with drug interaction, tolerance, psychoactivity and toxicity, and contraindication.

column1: Career Pathway Development, Part II Course
column2: Students in this course continue development of their career pathways in cooperation with industry mentors and academic institutions. Private and public industry professionals collaborate to assure that course material balances academic instruction with real world applications in a variety of vocational and technical fields relating to a student’s career objective. Students in this course receive personalized career mentoring to assist them in developing rewarding career pathways. This 8-week course is the second of a 16-week, two course sequence required for earning a Specialized Study Certificate in Career Development.

column1: Coaching and Mentoring: Developing Employees and Getting Results Course
column2: Examines the attitudes and attributes successful coaches and mentors use to empower others.  Topics include leading and coaching within an organization, identifying how to get the most out of people, your role as a leader, counselor, listener, facilitator and director and developing action plans for staff development and training.

column1: Cannabis Healthcare and Medicine II: Integrated Clinical Practice Course
column2: The second course for Cannabis Healthcare and Medicine probes into advanced physiological and pharmacological studies. Learners review complex aspects of the endocannabinoid system and explore the pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of cannabinoids and terpenes in the human body with regard to concentration, metabolism, absorption, distribution, and excretion. The final three weeks of Course II is modeled on clinical specializations and themes, with learners self-selecting for either an Animal and Pets or Human healthcare track: Clinical themes include autoimmune diseases, pain, mental health, neurodegenerative diseases, geriatrics, and cancer treatment.

column1: Cannabis Healthcare and Medicine II: Integrated Clinical Practice Course
column2: The second course for Cannabis Healthcare and Medicine probes into advanced physiological and pharmacological studies. Learners review complex aspects of the endocannabinoid system and explore the pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of cannabinoids and terpenes in the human body with regard to concentration, metabolism, absorption, distribution, and excretion. The final three weeks of Course II is modeled on clinical specializations and themes, with learners self-selecting for either an Animal and Pets or Human healthcare track: Clinical themes include autoimmune diseases, pain, mental health, neurodegenerative diseases, geriatrics, and cancer treatment.

column1: Contemporary Leadership and Intercultural Competence Course
column2: This course focuses on how to lead in a multicultural world.  It will explore the evolving role of cultural diversity in the workplace, and how to apply cultural comprehension to organizations. Students will learn about the tools leaders use in order to measure intercultural competence. Discussions include: understanding the basics of culture; developing and implementing a multicultural vision; managing cultural diversity; the legal implications of diversity; designing cultural learning programs; solving problems and resolving conflict; becoming more sensitive as a global manager. Learning will be augmented by readings from the GLOBE Research Project on Leadership Worldwide.  The four readings from this study will integrate with readings from the text, in order to develop a richer understanding of the effect of culture upon leadership in our globalized marketplace.

column1: Career Pathway Development Course
column2: This course helps students develop their career pathways in cooperation with industry mentors and academic institutions. Private and public industry professionals collaborate to assure that course material balances academic instruction with real world applications in a variety of vocational and technical fields relating to a student’s career objective. Students in this course receive personalized career mentoring to assist them in developing rewarding career pathways.

column1: Corporate Event Management Course
column2: There is a popular misconception that event planning is a generic discipline void of specialties within the field. Just as physicians specialize in certain areas of medicine, there are event planners who specialize in corporate events. These include profit as well as the non-profit sector. This class will explore the different type of corporate events such as incentive trips, press events, sales/marketing events, conventions, trade shows and educational symposiums. Participants will be able to explore all facets of corporate events from how to budget properly and utilizing creativity to keep corporate meetings and events fresh and cutting edge.

column1: Creative, Critical and Collaborative Thinking Course
column2: Explore step-by-step the art and science of decision-making that can apply to the workplace, as well as your personal life.  Learn about the differences between critical and everyday thinking, and how the components of critical thinking impact the choices and decisions we make. Building on the foundation of critical thinking, examine the creative, analytical and judgmental steps in the thinking process which compares the ideas generated and systematically eliminates the weakest ideas allowing decision-makers to confidently select the best solution for a given challenge. Then, discuss collaborative thinking in teams, how to harness the talents of the team members, ways to effectively deal with threats and challenges, and how to identify barriers that diverse teams face.

column1: Developing and Managing Your Event Business Course
column2: This course is designed to inspire you in making any event a memorable experience. You will be given the tools to develop your skills in building your event career by creating a small business plan model, collecting the necessary paperwork to start a business and developing your unique marketing plan as it relates to your target customers.

column1: Customer Service Management Course
column2: Participants examine best practices in customer service and how organizations use customer service to expand customer base.  Topics include initiating and sustaining quality improvement in customer relations, measuring customer satisfaction, developing and using performance indicators, differentiating customer service approaches, certification options, and the role of technology, workforce management and outsourcing in customer service.

column1: Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) - Lifting all Voices in an Organization Course
column2: Students will explore the topics of marginalization and oppression and examine how these concepts contribute to the overall understanding of privilege. Each week students will examine brief historical events or movements rooted in overcoming marginalization. Students will use these understandings to help nonprofits make better decisions, advocate for more equitable policies, and foster inclusive work cultures through an intersectional lens. Students will also examine potential scenarios where organizations could adopt a socially conscious framework to overcome and eliminate barriers.

column1: Donor Relations and Fundraising Course
column2: This class will explore key strategies, practical steps to take and tools used to build and maintain relationships with donors and funders. Donors, whether an individual or an institution are making an investment in the organization and what it is doing, but ultimately it is about relationships and trust between people. Maintaining and continually building the relationships is key to keeping long term donors, increasing funding over time and sustainability. The coursework will include specific techniques to address building trust, facing donors with authenticity while centered and committed to the vision and mission of the organization, the impact of early gifts and how to develop them over time, the importance of knowing your donors, how to research and build a dossier and use customer relationship management (CRM) software. It will present ideas for ongoing and appropriate communication with specific communication tools, techniques and the stories/narratives. This combination of soft and hard skills and approach will be presented through lectures, case stories, expert/experienced speakers and group learning with members of the class.

column1: Developing a Business Plan Course
column2: The key ingredient for a successful business is the business plan.  This course is designed for small to mid-sized businesses and individuals who are looking to start a business.  Participants will examine the process of developing and implementing a business plan.  Topics include what is a business plan and why prepare one, feasibility, analyzing the industry, examining the competition and understanding your market, goal setting, growth and long-term planning (exit strategy, succession, etc.), managing change.  Participants will develop a mock business plan.

column1: Developing Your Digital Professional Portfolio Course
column2: Provides students with an opportunity to become engaged in The Integrative Knowledge Portfolio Process (Peet et al., 2011) and to develop a Digital Professional Learning Portfolio. Through a series of learning modules, interactive exercises, and reflective writing assignments and prompts delivered in the classroom and online, students will develop reflective capabilities in assessing their tacit and explicit knowledge, skills, and capabilities, as well as their underlying personal values, goals, and philosophy. Students will integrate their learning in the context of a larger institutional culture that strongly emphasizes peer-to-peer learning, leadership development, and deep engagement with the world beyond the classroom. Students will utilize personal and professional insights to create a digital professional portfolio that can serve as a resource to pursue future employment opportunities, and as a basis for lifelong learning.

column1: Effective Business Presentations Course
column2: This Intensive seminar provides participants with skills necessary to make a variety of business presentations.  Topics include knowing your audience, knowing which presentation to use when, building rapport with your audience and effective use of audio-visual tools, evaluating yourself.  The tips learned in this program can help managers; professionals and executives make their presentations more effective and build confidence to ensure successful business presentations in the future.

column1: Effective Nonprofit Fundraising Strategies Course
column2: This course is a thorough examination of today’s most successful fundraising methods and theories. Students will gain an introduction to the basic terminology and concepts in the field, along with an overview of the development cycle from identification and cultivation through stewardship and recognition. They will learn how to develop a case for support, identify and assess prospective grants, donors, match a donor’s/funder’s interests and needs with organization’s mission and goals, structure a successful solicitation, and respond to ethical dilemmas. Most importantly, students will enhance their ability to raise and manage funds that fuel transformative social programs.

column1: Essentials of Business Management Course
column2: This is a survey course that provides students with an overview of key functional business areas.
